intro: Bellevalia olivieri, commonly known as the olive bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Bellevalia olivieri is often cultivated for its delicate blooms and ability to bloom in early spring.
